episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including the renaming of Finnish meatballs, Queen Victoria's unusual pet incident, the origins of the Statue of Liberty, and a peculiar study on how long it takes for sweets to dissolve in the nose.

facts.fact: Finished budget meatballs have so little meat in them that they have had to be renamed "Balls."
Queen Victoria's acquaintance once had to apologise to her after her pet jaguar killed three of the Queen's pet deer.
The Statue of Liberty originally wore a head scarf.
A Polo mint takes 42.5 minutes to dissolve if you stick it up your nose.
